Job Title: SPECIALIST, BEER/WINE/LIQUOR - 2237 Claribel Road, Riverbank, CA 95380

Location: Turlock, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
About Us

The Save Mart Companies is one of the largest food and drug retailers in California and Nevada. It is home to several well-known brands in food retailing. You might have seen our stores that include Save Mart, Lucky, Lucky California, and Food Maxx. We also have 3 distribution centers and our SMART Transportation trucking firm that transports dry groceries, frozen foods, ice, and novelties to all of The Save Mart Companies stores. We are a California grown business, headquartered in the heart of one of the greatest agricultural areas of our nation – Stanislaus County.

The Modesto community is vibrant with great traditions, educational opportunities, and multi-cultural lifestyles. Aside from mild weather year-round, Modesto allows for easy access to many major tourist attractions in California. To the west lies the San Francisco Bay Area (90-miles) and the Santa Cruz Beach (115-miles). To the east is the famed Gold Country “Mother Lode” (50-miles) and a little farther you can find the majestic Sierra Nevada Mountain range, Lake Tahoe (180-miles) and Yosemite National Park (110-miles).

Some of our competitive benefits include exceptionally generous benefits package (Health, Dental, Vision, Life, 401K), Lifelong Learning Educational opportunities, Employee Association (discounted and free tuition options, contests, and support services).

We Are Currently Recruiting For The Position Of

SPECIALIST, BEER/WINE/LIQUOR - 2237 Claribel Road, Riverbank, CA 95380

The Beer, Wine, & Liquor Specialist is an integral part of a highly motivated team focused on serving guests with an emphasis on the overall Beer, Wine, & Liquor department and Center Store Market guest experience to consistently meet or exceed guest expectations.

The Beer, Wine, & Liquor Specialist is responsible for all aspects of the beer, wine, and liquor department and all alcohol related displays in the store. The Specialist ensures all product related areas are fully stocked for our guests. The position will order, receive, stage, and stock products while ensuring proper inventory control, product rotation. This position will create and build product displays, ensure proper fronting of products, and handle product damages and credits according to company policy and regulatory guidelines. The Specialist must be familiar with store products, cross merchandising, and their locations in order to assist guests. The Specialist will have exposure to a variety of retail tasks related to product, guest service and merchandising.

Key Responsibilities And Accountabilities

 Provide guests with a remarkable shopping experience by greeting and thanking customers in a prompt, courteous and friendly manner, answering questions, and responding to customer requests Maintaining an up to date knowledge of various types of spirits, wine, beers, ales, and cocktails to advise guests on selection options and food pairing choices Up to date on the latest alcoholic trends and provide cross merchandising options for Center Store Market plans Stock beer, wine, and liquor store shelves and displays to ensure products availability, appeal, guest satisfaction and store profitability Ensure accurate regular and sale pricing of all merchandise items at shelf edge, computer/registry/IRIS inventory system Monitor sales, inventory, maintain back stock areas, and order products to maximize sales and profits Perform and/or ensure the receipt/check in, inspection and break-down for stocking of incoming goods to ensure product availability Maintain a clean and safe environment to ensure the safety of co-workers and guests Perform other duties as assigned

Hiring pay range: $16.25 - 23.70

Requirements (Knowledge, Skills And Abilities)

 Wide range of product/pricing knowledge, store layout, safe work/lifting practices, equipment operation, merchandising, and others. Abilities to learn and retain policies and procedure, to work within and promote a team environment, and the abilities to read, write and perform basic math calculations Must be familiar with store products and provide paring solutions

Education: High School Diploma (or G.E.D.) or additional job experience

Experience: Two years of center store experience; six months of Beer/Wine/Liquor experience is preferred

Other: Must be available to work a variety of shifts, to include evenings and weekends

Physical: Requires standing and other physical movements on a frequent basis and lifting up to 40 lbs. without assistance

Competencies

 Guest Focus Personal/Interpersonal Skills Communication Skills

Reference: req36289

Follow Us

 Instagram: @savemart

Facebook: Save Mart

YouTube: @savemartsupermarkets

LinkedIn: The Save Mart Companies

The Save Mart Companies is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we welcome resumes from individuals who will contribute to our diverse workforce.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
